intro: Geissopappus polycephalus, commonly known as the many-headed phlox, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It produces numerous small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Geissopappus polycephalus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
